item.title: Database Design and Implementation
item.description: Source Dataset information # Loading in packages: library(tidyverse) library(RSQLite) library(DBI) library(knitr) In the following project, I take the following csv (source dataset): music <- read.csv("music.csv") glimpse(music) ## Rows: 3,759 ## Columns: 28 ## $ TrackName <chr> "For Those About To Rock (We Salute You)", "B~ ## $ Composer <chr> "Angus Young, Malcolm Young, Brian Johnson", ~ ## $ TrackLength <int> 343719, 342562, 342562, 230619, 252051, 37541~ ## $ TrackSizeBytes <int> 11170334, 5510424, 5510424, 3990994, 4331779,~ ## $ TrackPrice <dbl> 0.

item.title: 2020 Election Visualizations
item.description: Project Outline In this project, we were given the datasets and asked to recreate these visuals. Many people were skeptical about the advent of mail-in ballots in the 2020 presidential election. Specifically, many pundits, news agencies, and politicians stated that mail-in ballots benifited democrats for whatever reason. In the following project, we take the state of Georgia, and figure out by county, how large the percentage of mail-in voters was.
